mcli.name: data-processing
mcli.description: Example workflow showing data processing with Python

source:
# Data Processing Workflow

This workflow demonstrates how to process data using Python in MCLI notebooks.

# Import standard libraries
import json
from datetime import datetime

print("Libraries imported successfully!")

# Create sample data
data = {
    "name": "Sample Dataset",
    "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat(),
    "values": [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]
}

print("Data created:")
print(json.dumps(data, indent=2, default=str))

# Process the data
total = sum(data['values'])
average = total / len(data['values'])

print(f"Total: {total}")
print(f"Average: {average}")

## Results

The data has been processed successfully. You can extend this workflow with your own data processing logic.
